original: Bergfelt, Martin Carl Jolian, Hilding, dövs tumpräst, Kungälv, f. 28/12/ 96 i Lyseikil av kontr: pro st Bengt Martin B. o. Anna Sofia Brusewitz. G. 23 m. Kerstin Gunnarson. Barn: Marianni f. 25, Birgitta 33. — Stud:-ex. i Gbg. 14, teol. fil. ex. 15, teol. kand. 18, prästv. 19. Dövstumpräist i Vänersb. dövstumsk idiistr. 23, i Vä-nersb. dövstumprästdistr. 38. Led. av stadsfu-llm. fr. 30, förste v. ordf. fr. 35, led. av kyrkoråd, av kyrkofullm., kyrkovärd, fd. tryckfrihetsombud.
translated: Bergfelt, Martin Carl Jolian, Hilding, deaf and mute priest, Kungälv, born December 28, 1896 in Lyseikil to Bengt Martin B. and Anna Sofia Brusewitz. Married in 1923 to Kerstin Gunnarson. Children: Marianni born in 1925, and Birgitta born in 1933. He graduated from Göteborgs högre allmänna läroverk (now Göteborgs högre samskola) in 1914, earned a Bachelor of Arts in Theology in 1915, became a Candidate of Theology in 1918, and was ordained as a priest in 1919. He served as a deaf and mute priest in Vänersborg's deaf and mute school district from 1923 and in Vänersborg's deaf and mute priest district from 1938. He was a member of the city council from 1930, First Vice Chairman from 1935, and also a member of the church council, church board, church warden, and a former freedom of the press ombudsman.

memberOf.name: Vänersborg deaf and mute school district
